response.original_title: O Lado Que A Cidade Não Vê
response.overview: A short documentary that follows the daily lives of three trans individuals in Goiânia—Fernando, a women’s clothing vendor; Gustavo, a photographer and trans rights activist; and Cristal, a dance student and manicurist. As they navigate a transphobic, sexist, and racist society, the documentary highlights how systemic prejudice blocks their access to fair employment. Through intimate, observational scenes, the film reveals not only their struggles, but also their perseverance and dignity in pursuing livelihoods. Director
response.title: O Lado Que A Cidade Não Vê
